text: what would you say is the easiest thing
that you can make for dinner would you
say it was a roast because if you're not
saying a roast you've got it all wrong
roasts are one of the easiest things
that you can do basically they're full
of flavor right on their own give them a
little salt and pepper throw some
vegetables in there in the pan with them
and cook them and you have dinner with
barely any effort in about an hour I
have a beautiful pork loin roast it's
not to be confused with a pork
tenderloin which is much much smaller
got a little bit of fat on the top I'm
trimming a little bit you really don't
need to trim that much unless you really
really don't like it but I find that it
keeps the pork really moist as it's
roasting and then you can take it off
before you eat it if you want to once
that's trimmed just get rid of the fat
you want to tie it at half inch
intervals just to make it nice and

can buy pretty much everywhere and I'm
just cutting it into lengths instead of
using that ultra professional butcher
method I have an oven at 475 degrees I
find that roasting meats at a high
temperature really gets it nice and
caramelized on the outside which I love

but also using your spoon to scrape up
any brown bits on the bottom of the pan
dual purpose it's making a sauce and
getting all those delicious brown bits
from the bottom of your pan and then all
you want to do is once everything is
incorporated and you haven't made any
lumps then add the rest of your stock
and bring it to a boil
and as it comes to a boil the flour will
activate and it'll thicken the sauce and
you'll have a little gravy my sauce is
